name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites, Williamsburg-Historic Gateway

reviews.text: You will not be disappointed when visiting Williamsburg and staying here. Our room was spacious, super clean, awesome and comfortable beds. The pool area is clean and nice and the hot tub very good. The manager at the desk that checked us in was super nice and very welcoming. The hotel is a short drive from everything around Williamsburg. We visit Williamsburg often and this is the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in other than the high end Colonial hotels like the Inn and Lodge. Perfect for families.
reviews.title: Perfect, spacious, clean and super service

reviews.text: Hi everybody I would like to tell you about our stay at the best Hotel Bar none!! Where you and your family feel like if you was at home. From the Housekeeping to the Kitchen and Dining room staff to the Front desk and MG, and Gm they treat you like there own, the hospitality is five star status and when i spoke to other guests that was staying there it was no complaints and people agreed and felt the same way we felt. Listen i have to give a special thanks to Housekeeping from Marisol, to Tiwanna and Blossom where ou belongings as well as our room service was always well kept. When it came to Breakfest the food was top choice all you can eat buffet of your choice and dinner was as equal Southern hospitality homestyle cooking!!. From Chef Shaun to Chef James and protege Ryan and Hostess Josh, Stacey, Mary and Lynn. Also cannot forget Front Desk David and MG Michael we felt as homely as possible the work ethic that GM Geoffrey displays and staff performs is top notch other business should be runed like it. P.S. me and my family can't wait to get back and we will be bringing others to experience a slice of Heaven in williamsburgh Virginia Holiday Inn Historic Gateway
reviews.title: We have chosen to stay where we feel at home!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a quick overnight trip with my boyfriend. The hotel is exceptionally clean and tastefully decorated. Check-in and check-out was quick and efficient. The staff is super friendly and helpful. You also can't beat the location--only minutes to all the major attractions in Williamsburg. The room amenities--fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and both firm/soft pillows were an awesome addition. The hotel is also quite sound-proof (which was such a relief after a long and busy day). Overall this is a great choice for couples, families, and even business travelers! I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Awesome location, friendly staff, excellent amenities!

reviews.text: This was my first time staying at this particular Holiday Inn, but I was blown away at the level of cleanliness of the accommodations and professionalism from all of the staff. I only got to stay for one night, but check-in was a breeze, and I was on my way to my room less than 2 minutes after I gave my name to the front desk, with a full explanation of the features of the property and a smile.
reviews.title: Easy to see why its the top rated

reviews.text: When I entered my room I was astounded that my room was as big as it was, a similarly priced room in other hotels in the area were nearly half the size. The bed was super comfy, and the curtains could be drawn all the way closed (very important for non-early risers!) The bathroom was very well-lit and well spaced out. Other hotels make you feel like you are pooping in a closet!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel !!!

reviews.text: We went on a family vacation to Williamsburg, Va and wanted a nice hotel that was in the middle of attractions, kid friendly and nice accomodations. The Holiday Inn and Suites at the Historic Gateway was very well located minutes from Colonial Williamsburg and close to Busch Gardens and Water Country and easy to get to Jamestown and Yorktowne. The holiday was relatively new, the rooms were very nice and well appointed. There was a nice indoor pool for the kids and meals for kids are free all day long. The food was good, but not a big selection. The bistro featured a little bar and TVs in the booths for the kids. The front desk was okay, I did not find them to be very helpful with much. I guess I was expecting more Southern hospitality, and a little more for the money, but overall it was worth it.
reviews.title: Great location in Williamsburg

reviews.text: We stayed here recently and it was our first visit to a Holiday Inn. We were only staying a night so that we could take the kids to Busch Gardens for 2 days. So we started our trip at Busch Gardens for the day and didn't get to the hotel until around 7:30pm that night to check in. Upon checking in we were greeted very warmly by Catherine at the front desk. She gave us our room key and we went up to check on the room. My husband is very concerned with bed bugs and checked the room throughly...good news, NO signs of bed bugs at all. The room was nicely laid out and the furniture was very clean (no stains and not worn out looking).
reviews.title: Top notch customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, after pulling the sofa bed out we noticed what looked like dirt/fuzzies all over the sheets on the sofa bed. There was also a small stain on the sheets on the king bed. We went to the front desk and explained our situation also asking if by chance there was a roll a way bed we could use for the night for our oldest son. Catherine was very apologetic and immediately offered to resolve the situation. Jan (the manager I think) was also there and said it would be taken care of immediately. They both apologized and said it would be taken care of. We were going back to Busch Gardens for the fireworks so we were going to be out of the room for a bit anyway. So we went and enjoyed the fireworks and returned around 10pm.
reviews.title: Cracking hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, when we returned we came back to freshly made beds and a plate of chocolate chip cookies and balloons in our room! It also had a note, saying they were sorry for the inconvenience and to please have breakfast downstairs in the morning on them for our entire family. They also had brought up a roll a way bed for our son! They also took $50 off of our bill for the inconvenience. (This was totally unexpected, but throughly impressed my husband and I.) WOW, that is great customer service!
reviews.title: Special thanks to Jan Harrington and manager Jeff

reviews.text: The breakfast downstairs was good. We had a wonderful waitress in the morning (an older lady, sorry I don't have her name). But she took our note and said she would take care of us and she did. It was typical breakfast fare buffet style, but they had an omelet station where you could request your own omelet/eggs (we didn't try it, but they looked good).
reviews.title: Fantastic...

reviews.text: I selected this hotel after reading the other tripadvisor reviews. The reviews were all true and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a suite on Aug 24, 2012. The rooms were even larger than I imagined, even after reading the reviews. There was even a door separating the bedroom from the living room area, which is a feature not found very often in suites. From the pleasant check-in to the quick and pleasant check-out, the staff was courteous and professional. The breakfast was very reasonably priced, delicious and had a range of food for almost everyone: oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, to order omelets and waffles, bacon, sausage, etc. The restaurant booths even have small TVs and parents will appreciate the plastic cups with lids and flex straws. In other words, it's apparent that the hotel goes to great lenghts to ensure that guests have what they need. As for location, the hotel is only a few miles from all of the major attractions. This will be my family's hotel for future trips to the Williamsburg,VA area.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Courteous Staff & Large Rooms

reviews.text: We recently stayed in this hotel for a stopover to OBX. I was able to use my Priority Club points for a free night's stay. Let me say that if I had to pay, I would have been upset, and raised a bigger fuss than I did. However, I digress...
reviews.title: Not terrible for a free night...

reviews.text: We checked in late, and went up to our room - 2 queen beds. The hallway on the 3rd floor was incredibly close and stuffy - no air circulating. (It was the same way the next morning.) Our room was spacious, and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Just a so so hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were short on wash clothes in the bathroom, and so I called down to the front desk, and was told we would receive them shortly. We waited for an hour, and no one brought them. By this time, it was 10pm, our children were on the verge of meltdowns, so we made do with what we had.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay

reviews.text: The bathroom was mostly clean - the tub had some hair from the previous occupant in it - that always makes me completely grossed out. Unfortunately, my 1-year old daughter had thrown up in the car, and needed a bath desperately.
reviews.title: Same Day Reservation

reviews.text: I booked a family reunion with this hotel due to it being fairly central to all the main attractions and my experiences with other Holiday Inns. I must say that I was not disappointed at the level of service and the rooms at all. The rooms are exactly as they are represented in the picture. It was clean, the bed was very comfortable, the floors was very quiet-even with all the families that were staying there. I was very pleased with the cleanliness of the bathroom and the supplies. They have an outside patio right off the indoor pool - which is where the adults hung out into late at night. It was very relaxing.
reviews.title: 2012 Family Reunion

reviews.text: Because it was a reunion - we planned two events at the hotel. One was a welcome reception in the York room. We selected a Mexican buffet and I must say the food was excellent! Everything was cooked with care. I didn't get the feeling we were getting hospital food but a home cooked meal (thanks Chef Shawn)! The following morning, we had an all you can eat breakfast buffet. This was also extremely delicious (bacon, eggs, sausages, home fries, grits, fruit & cereal). The food was made with the hand of a real cook and seasoned perfectly. The best part of using the banquet services was the servers (especially Valentin and Angela and Shawn)- they were awesome and went out of their way to meet all of our expectations. On Saturday, we discovered two people didn't eat pork and someone else who wanted regular tea. They didn't have it on site - so they sent someone out to the store to purchase the items.
reviews.title: A nice find!

reviews.text: I have nothing but great things to say about the Hotel! I definitely will be going back to Va and this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic all around

reviews.text: Stayed here for ten nights and was very impressed. For a three star hotel it was very nice. We had a two bedroom suite which had a large living area which was great because it gave us that extra space. The only criticism we had was the housekeeping. Our bathroom could have been cleaned better and I had to leave a note to have clean sheets - after all we were staying a while. The reception staff were all friendly and helpful. Although they say they have a shop it is so small and well under stocked, they shouldn't bother. If you are in the area you should try this hotel.
reviews.title: My son was happy

reviews.text: We loved this hotel. It's clean and completely-renovated. The location is perfect if you're going to Colonial Williamsburg and is close to great restaurants and shops. The breakfast buffet had nice variety, and my kids loved the pool. We'd definitely go back.
reviews.title: Nice stay with the family.
